# 3.2. Loops

Suppose you want to remove a letter from a column of data. Now, suppose that you want to remove a letter from 9,000 columns of data. You are going to need a system to do the same thing over and over: you are going to need a loop.

## `for` and `while`

R understands `for` and `while` loops like many other programming languages.

## `apply` functions

Loops are fantastic but can become memory-intensive. R also offers [`apply` functions](http://badhessian.org/loops-matrices-and-apply-functions/) that can usually do what you might want to do with a loop.
